result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley M. Larsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Consecutive to: Any sentence that may exist in the event of a revocation.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with T. Vest-McKellip unless specifically authorized by supervising agent.
Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley M. Larsen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
15CM183 & 15CM401 Cases called @ 2:44 p.m.  Defendant Bradley M. Larsen in court with attorney Scott M Engstrom.  Defendant Bradley M. Larsen in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM401 - Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Repeater enhancer dismissed outright. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Engstrom. No statement by the defendant. Court orders: 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - consecutive to any sentence that may exist in the event of a revocation, 18 mos probation - Conditions: DAAP and follow through, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, NC w/ T. Vest-McKellip unless specifically authorized by supervising agent, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.

15CM183 - Parties have received the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be made. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. The parties stipulate to 61 days CFTS.  Court orders: 8 mos WCJ on both counts concurrent - Huber, GT, 61 days CFTS, costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid. Appeal rights given.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:14 p.m. Defendant Bradley M. Larsen in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $2000 Sig Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting a small cash bond. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond. NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
